title: The Boards are broken for me. Anyone else experiencing the same issues?
body:
Lately (that is to say, the last 3-4 days or so), the Boards have been acting up for me.

Some of the problems I've stumbled upon include:

* Can't access my own, nor other Summoner Profiles, with seemingly random exceptions.

* Can't switch to Discussion View, even though the button is there. Is stuck in Chronological View.

* Can't switch to sort by Hot on the Boards Home Page, even though the button is there, and I can't switch to sort by Recent in other Boards (I have only encountered an inability to sort by Recent in Story, Art & Sound so far).

* Upvoting/downvoting a post takes significantly longer for me, with pop-ups telling me I'm "not authorized" when attempting to.

* Making new posts, this one included, is also more difficult, requiring several clicks before it can go through.

Anyone else experiencing some of the same issues?

Can the Moderators confirm if y'all have detected any problems with the site?

replies.body: Sorry for leaving this in the dark! I shared this up a few days ago and it looks like some of the backend has been fixed up from its buggy state. Let me know if you see any other issues with the Boards that isn't working properly and I'll escalate it up to be looked into.
Works fine for me, thank you.

It's all good! Periscope already confirmed that the problem's been solved.

There is, of course, still the issue of me being unable to see the discussions I've made under my Boards profile, though this issue is has persisted for well over a year now, and is unrelated to the recent problems.

Well I think that is his point. People like wuks are doing an incredible job for someone who is just a volunteer working with very limited tools. But it shouldn't be left up to a volunteer like that, Riot should be willing to hire at least a *single* employee to actually be a developer for the boards. The fact a multi-billion dollar company running the world's most popular game is using volunteers to run it's own official forum is kind of sad.

Well, I know for a fact that Keyru is in charge of the Boards (or, at least the moderation team), so Riot hasn't completely abandoned us (yet), but you're right.

I heard that the people that are (or were, I guess?) in charge of development on the Boards is something called the "Apollo Team", a company(?) separate from Riot, but after talking with the moderators (and even Keyru), they say communication with them isn't possible at the moment.

Not only that, but I can't find any concrete results for this "Apollo Team" on the internet.

Which is, you know, suspicious to say the least, but I digress.

I have seen the moderators themselves state on occasion that the reason the moderation team is composed of volunteers is because "we do this job for free because we care about the community" or something like that, and that moderators are somehow unable to be paid for their work and care for the community simultaneously.

Which I, again, find odd, but it's not really in my control (nor my responsibility) to begin with.
